lead_paragraph: A pipeline break created a water shortage for nearly 800,000 Southern Californians today, and residents were asked to stop filling pools, watering lawns and washing clothes for at least a week. ''This isn't a joke,'' said Dave Seymour of the Rancho Santa Margarita Water District. ''This really is a crisis. People are taking it very seriously. We've had people calling to tell us their neighbors are watering the lawns and washing their cars.''
abstract: Pipeline break creates water shortage for nearly 800,000 residents of Orange County, Calif; officials plead for voluntary conservation (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; California Pipeline Break Cuts Water to 800,000
